definition: surname Song/the Song dynasty (960-1279)/also Song of the Southern dynasties 南朝宋 (420-479)
soup/hot or boiling water/decoction of medicinal herbs/water in which sth has been boiled

sentences.english: I'd like a borsch to begin.
Of course, in the Jewish tradition, borscht is never made with pork.
sentences.chinese: 當然，在猶太人的傳統中，羅宋湯是從來不放豬肉的。

sentences.english: Borscht can be spiced up with roasted apples and smoked goose breast.
sentences.chinese: 羅宋湯可以用烘烤過的蘋果和薰鵝脯來提味。

sentences.english: Borscht is most common on the east coast, especially in New York.
sentences.chinese: 羅宋湯在東海岸很普遍，尤其在紐約。

sentences.english: Please give us two steam meat and Borsch.
sentences.chinese: 請給我們來兩份蒸肉和羅宋湯。

sentences.english: And white borscht, this is recipe my grandma.
sentences.chinese: 白羅宋湯是我奶奶的主要食譜。

sentences.english: Borscht is a very common dish in Germany and Eastern Europe.
sentences.chinese: 羅宋湯在德國和東歐很常見的菜餚。

sentences.english: However, beet borscht is the most common form of this soup.
sentences.chinese: 但甜菜羅宋湯是最常見的一種。

sentences.english: Cold borscht is common to the culinary traditions of Ashkenazi Jews.
sentences.chinese: 冷羅宋湯在德系猶太人的烹飪傳統中較常見。

sentences.english: Cold borscht is much thinner than hot borscht and is almost always vegetarian.
sentences.chinese: 冷羅宋湯比熱羅宋湯更清淡，而且幾乎只有蔬菜。

sentences.english: Cold borscht is much thinner than hot borscht and is almost always vegetarian.
sentences.chinese: 冷羅宋湯比熱羅宋湯更清淡，而且幾乎只有蔬菜。

definition: imagawayaki (sweet snack made of batter cooked in the shape of a car wheel, stuffed with azuki bean paste or other fillings)
Sichuan noodles with a spicy and numbing sauce
rice in gravy, typically with meat and vegetables
chicken in rice wine/also translated drunken chicken
gimbap (Korean rice roll similar in appearance to sushi)/kimbap
